t: And*p he shewed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of the Lord,*s and Satan standing at his right hand to resist him.
And*p the Lord*s said unto Satan, The Lord*s rebuke thee, O Satan; even the Lord*s that hath chosen Jerusalem rebuke thee: is not this a brand plucked out of the fire?
Now*p Joshua was clothed with filthy garments, and stood before the angel.

And*p he answered and spake unto those that stood before him, saying, Take away the filthy garments from him. And unto him he said, Behold, I have caused thine iniquity to pass from thee, and I will clothe thee with change of raiment.
And*p I said, Let them set a fair mitre upon his head. So they set a fair mitre upon his head, and clothed him with garments. And the angel of the Lord*s stood by.
And*p the angel of the Lord*s protested unto Joshua, saying,

Thus*p saith the Lord*s of hosts; If thou wilt walk in my ways, and if thou wilt keep my charge, then thou shalt also judge my house, and shalt also keep my courts, and I will give thee places to walk among these that stand by.
Hear*p now, O Joshua the high priest, thou, and thy fellows that sit before thee: for they are men wondered at: for, behold, I will bring forth my servant the BRANCH.

For*p behold the stone that I have laid before Joshua; upon one stone shall be seven eyes: behold, I will engrave the graving thereof, saith the Lord*s of hosts, and I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.
In*p that day, saith the Lord*s of hosts, shall ye call every man his neighbour under the vine and under the fig tree.
